法規內容.條文內容: This Regulation is promulgated in accordance with Paragraph 2, Article 66 of the Statute for the Development of Tourist Industry.

Tourist hotels operated by tourist hotel enterprises are divided into international tourist hotels and standard tourist hotels, whose respective buildings and facilities shall be consistent with provisions in the Standard for Buildings and Facilities of Tourist Hotels.

All matters concerning the establishment, change, transfer, inspection, guidance, reward, punishment and supervision of tourist hotel enterprises are mandated by the MOTC for execution by the Tourism Bureau of the MOTC, except that the MOTC may authorize the competent city governments to execute such matters concerning ordinary tourist hotel enterprises under their direct jurisdiction.
Matters concerning the issuance of tourist hotel enterprise licenses are mandated by the MOTC for execute by the Tourism Bureau of the MOTC.
The matters mandated and authorized as provided for in the preceding two paragraphs, and the legal basis thereof, shall be publicly announced and published in the government gazette.

A hotel whose operation has not been approved in accordance with this Regulation may not use the name of“international tourist hotel” or “standard tourist hotel”, nor may it use the exclusive trade symbol therefor.
Each exclusive trade symbol for international tourist hotels or standard tourist hotels shall bear a serial number for registration and control. An example of the exclusive trade symbol is shown in the attachment.

法規內容.編章節: Chapter II Establishment, Licensing, and Changes of Tourist Hotel Enterprises

法規內容.條文內容:
A tourist hotel enterprise shall produce the following documents to apply to the administrative authority for approval of establishment:
1. Application form for establishing a tourist hotel enterprise.
2. List of founders or list of directors and supervisors.
3. Corporate charter.
4. Business plan.
5. Financial plan.
6. Land registration transcript and land-use zoning certification of within the preceding three months; if the applicant is other than the owner of the land, written agreement of the owner or owners for the right to use the land shall also be attached. For an existing building intended to be used as a tourist hotel, the building registration transcript of within the preceding three months shall be provided; if the applicant is other than the owner of the building, written agreement of the owner or owners for the right to use the building shall also be attached.
7. Blueprint of hotel building.
8. General manual of hotel facilities.
Applications for establishing tourist hotel enterprises shall be processed by the Tourism Bureau under the commission of the Ministry of Transportation and Communications (hereinafter MOTC), with the exception that applications for establishing standard tourist hotel enterprises in a municipality under direct jurisdiction of the Executive Yuan shall be processed by that municipal government under the commission of the MOTC. The administrative authority concerned shall notify in writing to the applicant of the result of application review within fifteen (15) days after receiving the application, and, when an application has been approved, shall forward a copy of the approval notice to the related administrative authorities.
The administrative authority may charge a fee from the applicant for reviewing the blueprint of the tourist hotel. An additional fee may be charged for the review of changes in the blueprint.

A tourist hotel enterprise that has been approved for establishment in accordance with the preceding article shall register as a corporation as required by law, and shall produce the following documents to submit to the original processing authority for filing:
1. Photocopy of documentary proof of corporate registration.
2. List of directors and supervisors.
In the event of change in any of the items of its corporate registration, the hotel enterprise in question shall report such changes to the processing authority within fifteen (15) days upon the date of approval by the administrative authority.

The Chinese name and foreign-language name of a tourist hotel may not be identical with or similar to that of another registered tourist hotel, except for a tourist hotel that has joined an international or domestic hotel chain and has completed the due reporting procedures in accordance with Article 31 of this Regulation.

After a tourist hotel has been approved for establishment, the applicant shall within two years apply to the local construction authority for the issuance of a tourist hotel construction license, and within fifteen days of receiving such license shall submit it to the original processing authority for filing. If a building provided for use as a tourist hotel has already obtained a license for use, the applicant shall within two years of receiving approval for establishment apply to the local construction authority for the issuance of a license for its use as a tourist hotel, and within fifteen days of receiving such license shall submit it to the original processing authority for filing. Failure to apply for and obtain a construction or usage license within the stipulated time shall result in the revocation of the establishment approval, and a copy of this revocation notice shall be sent to related administrative authorities. However, in case there is valid reason for delay, the applicant may apply to the original processing authority for an extension, with reasons stated, before reaching the deadline.
If the applicant company has been dissolved or its corporate registration has been terminated during the establishment phase, its establishment approval shall be rendered invalid.
In the event of change in the original building design of a tourist hotel enterprise prior to or during the construction phase, the applicant shall present the revised blueprint and related documents to the original processing authority for approval, and shall complete due procedures in accordance with relevant construction laws and regulations.
When the ownership of a tourist hotel enterprise is transferred to a different party during its establishment phase, the enterprise shall produce the following documents to apply to the original processing authority for approval:
1. Application form for transfer of tourist hotel enterprise establishment approval.
2. Duplicate copy of the related contract.
3. Minutes of the stockholder meeting or written agreement of the stockholders pertaining
to the transferor.
4. Business plan and financial plan pertaining to the transferee.
When a tourist hotel enterprise undergoes merger during its establishment phase, the continuing or newly established company shall submit the following documents to the original processing authority for filing:
1. Minutes of the stockholder meeting and directors meeting approving the merger.
2. Duplicate copies of the company merger registration documentation and the merger contract.
3. Registration documents for change in ownership of land and buildings.
4. Business plan and financial plan for the continuing or newly established company.

Having completed the establishment, a tourist hotel enterprise shall produce the following documents to apply for joint inspection by the original processing authority and police, construction management, fire, health, and other competent authorities. The enterprise may start operation only after it has passed such joint inspection and obtained an operation license and exclusive trade symbol for tourist hotel enterprises issued by the Tourism Bureau of the MOTC:
1. Application form for business operating license of tourist hotel enterprise.
2. Photocopy of building use permit and pictures of the finished buildings.
3. Duplicate copy of corporate registration documentation.

When a tourist hotel with over three hundred (300) guest rooms has met the following conditions during its construction phase, the enterprise may apply for inspection in accordance with the regulations provided for in the preceding article. Business operation may only commence after the applicant has passed the inspection and obtained operation license and exclusive trade symbol for tourist hotel enterprises:
1. Possession of the building use permit for all the buildings of the tourist hotel in question and pictures of the finished buildings.
2. Sixty percent (60%) of the guest rooms and no less than two hundred and forty (240) guest rooms shall be furnished and all operational floors shall be completely furnished.
3. The total floor area of the restaurants in operation shall be no less than that of the number of guest rooms in operation multiplied by 1.5 square meters, and the floors in operation shall be furnished.
4. Hallway floor, reception area, elevators, restaurant kitchens, cloakrooms, and restrooms shall be completely furnished.
5. Clear warning signs shall be displayed on unfurnished floors for the safety of lodgers.
A tourist hotel enterprise that is allowed to start such early business operation shall complete the furnishing of the entire hotel within one year, and shall apply for and pass the inspection in accordance with the preceding article. However, in case there is valid reason, the enterprise may apply with the original processing authority for an extension, the duration of which shall not exceed one year.

The regulations on the establishment of a tourist hotel enterprise shall apply mutates mutandis to the expansions, alterations and renovations of tourist hotel building , with the exception that lists of founders, board directors or supervisors of the corporation in question need not be submitted.

For an approved tourist hotel, having started business operation, that occupies only part of a building that incorporates other building uses on the same foundation in an integrated design, when other parts of the same building are to be converted for the use of tourist hotel, the tourist hotel enterprise shall produce the following documents to apply with the original processing authority for approval:
1. Business plan.
2. Financial plan.
3. Photocopy of land ownership certificate, or letter of consent for right to use, of those building sections to be converted into part of the tourist hotel in this application.
4. Building blueprint.
5. Manual of building facilities.
After the construction for such conversion purpose has been completed, the aforesaid tourist hotel enterprise shall produce the following documents to apply with the original processing authority for approval, and may commence business only after it has obtained such approval:
1. Photocopy of document proof of approval for change in building use permit, and pictures of the finished buildings
2. Document proof of passing inspection by the competent authorities on matters pertaining to building management, facilities for fire prevention and emergency exits, air-raid shelters, firefighting equipment, sanitation, and security.

Any change in the use of the lobby, guest rooms, restaurants, conference venues, recreational facilities, shops and other business areas of a tourist hotel shall be reported to the original processing authority for approval prior to the making of such change. When a change has been made, the area in question may not be used until it has passed inspection by the original processing authority and is found to be in conformity with the Standards for Buildings and Facilities of Tourist Hotels.
The original processing authority shall notify related authorities of changes as referred to in the preceding paragraph, for such authorities to carry out pertinent functions as stipulated by law.

In the event of any change in the organization, name, address, or representative of a tourist hotel enterprise, the enterprise shall within fifteen (15) days of the date of approval for change in corporate registration by the related administrative authority, produce the following documents to register such change with the original processing authority, and for the Tourism Bureau of the MOTC to reissue the tourist hotel operating license:
1. Application form for change in tourist hotel enterprise registration.
2. Photocopies of documentary proof of corporate registration and minutes of stockholder meeting or written agreement of stockholders or minutes of board meeting.
Any change in the name of a tourist hotel belonging to a tourist hotel enterprise shall be subject to the provisions of the preceding paragraph, except that the requirement for approval of change in corporate registration by the relevant administrative authority does not apply.

The Ministry of Transportation and Communications may conduct tourist hotel enterprise rating evaluations, and issue a rating symbol according to the results of the evaluations.
The conduct of tourist hotel enterprise evaluations as referred to in the preceding paragraph may be mandated by the Ministry of Transportation and Communications to the Tourism Bureau of the Ministry of Transportation and Communications or commissioned to a non-government organization; the matters so mandated or commissioned and the legal basis thereof shall be publicly announced and published in the government gazette.
When the Ministry of Transportation and Communications mandates the Tourism Bureau or commissions a non-government organization to conduct rating evaluations as described in Paragraph 1 above, the basis of the evaluations and the rating symbol shall be determined by the Tourism Bureau of the Ministry of Transportation and Communications according to the standard of buildings and facilities, the management situation, and the quality of services.
A tourist hotel enterprise shall place its symbol of hotel rating, issued by the administrative authority, in a highly visible place of its lobby.
A tourist hotel enterprise that is unable to operate due to practical or legal causes shall return its rating symbol within fifteen days of the occurrence of the practical cause or the imposition of an administrative penalty; if it fails to comply with this time limit, the Ministry of Transportation and Communications itself, or the Tourism Bureau acting under mandate in accordance with the procedure set out in Paragraph 2 above, may publicly announce the cancellation of its rating symbol. However, this provision shall not apply to a tourist hotel enterprise that temporarily suspends operation under the provisions of Article 29-1 of these Regulations.
A tourist hotel enterprise applying for the issuance, replacement, or reissuance of an operating license and/or exclusive symbol shall pay a stipulated fee therefor.

法規內容.編章節: Chapter III Operation and Management of Tourist Hotel Enterprises

法規內容.條文內容:
A tourist hotel enterprise shall maintain loose-leaf lodger registration books to record information on lodgers in accordance with the required format on a daily basis, and shall submit this information to the local police station or sub-station. The time for submitting such information shall be determined by local police department or station.
The lodger registration books indicated in the preceding paragraph shall be kept in inventory for half a year.

A tourist hotel enterprise shall arrange the safekeeping of money, valuable securities, jewelries or other valuable goods deposited by lodgers, shall provide receipt upon request by lodgers, and shall be held legally responsible for reparations in the event of any damage to or loss of such deposited goods.

Upon discovering luggage or possessions left behind by lodgers, the tourist hotel shall register their features as well as time and place of discovery, and arrange their safekeeping. The tourist hotel shall inform the owner to reclaim or send them back to the owner if the owner and the owner’s　address is known or if the owner is unknown, and shall report to the competent police authority for management.

A tourist hotel enterprise shall purchase liability insurance policy for its businesses, with the pertinent coverage and minimum insured value as specified below:
1. Human bodily injury or death, per person: NT$ 2 million.
2. Human bodily injury or death caused in each incident: NT$ 10 million.
3. Loss of or damage to property in each incident: NT$ 2 million.
4. Total insured value for the insured period: NT$ 24 million.

The operation and management of tourist hotel enterprises shall conform to the following provisions:
1. A tourist hotel shall not act as an agent of sexual services for lodgers, engage in behaviors against good social order, or defraud the lodgers.
2. An enterprise with affiliated performance venues shall not hire unapproved foreign entertainers for performance.
3. An enterprise with dance nightclub shall not hire or act as an agent of dance partners or escorts, be they professional or non-professional, for customers.

A tourist hotel enterprise shall take necessary measures or report to the local police station upon discovering any of the following conditions pertaining a lodger:
1. Suspicion of jeopardizing national security.
2. Carrying of guns and weapons, dangerous goods, or other prohibited goods.
3. Consumption of addictive drugs or other narcotics.
4. Showing of signs of committing suicide or being dead.
5. Participating in group gambling or engaging in other behavior that causes a disturbance to the public or violates public order or good social morals, while refusing to follow order to desist.
6. Forcible taking of lodgment without presenting proper identification documentation, or refusing to register for the lodgment.
7. Showing signs for suspicion of having committed other crimes.
Upon discovering the illness of a lodger, the tourist hotel enterprise shall immediately help the lodger get medical treatment within twenty-four hours.

The room rates for guest rooms in a tourist hotel, as well as changes in those rates, may be fixed by the tourist hotel enterprise, and shall be reported to the original processing authority for filing, with a duplicate copy of the report sent to the local tourist hotel enterprises association.
Room rates fixed by tourist hotel enterprises, matters for the attention of residing guests, and maps of emergency exits shall be displayed in a clearly visible place in guest rooms.

A tourist hotel enterprise shall have its exclusive trade symbol displayed in a highly visible place in its hallway. A tourist hotel enterprise that has applied for and been approved of the cancellation of its operation license or that has been subject to penalties of business suspension or license revocation shall return the exclusive trade symbol. Failure to return the exclusive trade symbol in accordance with the preceding sentence shall result in the cancellation of that exclusive trade symbol by the administrative authority via public announcement, and the enterprise in question may no longer use this exclusive trade symbol.

A tourist hotel enterprise that collects an own-beverage service charge shall display the method of collecting payment, basis of calculation, and other pertinent matters conspicuously on its website, menu and business premises.

Before or after commencing its business operation, a tourist hotel enterprise shall not solicit the sales of parts or all of its buildings or facilities by promising payments in the form of rental or profit.

After commencing its business operation, a tourist hotel enterprise shall submit the following information to the Tourism Bureau of the MOTC and the city government under whose jurisdiction it falls, in conformity with the required format, and by the deadlines respectively specified below:
1. Monthly revenues, occupancy rates, number of lodgers, and actual records of foreign exchange income, by the fifteenth day of the following month.
2. Balance sheet and income statement, by June 30 of the following year.

The tourist hotel buildings duly operated by a tourist hotel enterprise may be transferred only in their entirety. be transferred. They shall not be transferred in separate parts to different parties.
When a tourist hotel enterprise leases out or transfers to another party all of its tourist hotel buildings and facilities for operation as a tourist hotel enterprise, both parties shall produce the following documents to apply to the original processing authority for approval:
1. Application form for transfer of approval to establish a tourist hotel.
2. Duplicate copy of the relevant contract.
3. Minutes of stockholder meeting or written agreement of stockholders from the lessor or transferer.
4. Business plan and financial plan of the lessee or transferee.
After the aforesaid application has been approved, the lessee or transferee shall complete the due procedures for new corporate registration or change in corporate registration within two months, and both parties shall produce the following documents to apply for approval from the original processing authority, for the Tourism Bureau of the MOTC to issue a tourist hotel enterprise operating license:
1. Application form for tourist hotel enterprise operating license.
2. Operating license of the tourist hotel enterprise previously issued.
3. Corporate charter, photocopy of documentary proof of corporate registration, and lists of board directors and supervisors, of the lessee or transferee.
The lessee or the transferee may apply, with reasonable cause, for the deadline stipulated in the preceding paragraph to be extended one time for two months.

If, owing to corporate merger, all of the tourist hotel buildings and facilities of a tourist hotel enterprise are taken over by a continuing or newly established company, that company shall produce the following documents to apply to the original processing authority for approval:
1. Minutes of merger resolution of stockholder meeting or board of directors meeting or written agreement of stockholders.
2. Copies of corporate merger registration documentation and merger agreement.
3. Documentary proof of registration of transfer of ownership of land and buildings.
4. Business plan and financial plan of continuing or newly established company.
After approval of the aforementioned application, the continuing or newly established company shall complete the due procedures for change in corporate registration within two months, and shall produce the following documents to apply for approval from the original processing authority, for the Tourism Bureau of the MOTC to issue a tourist hotel enterprise operating license:
1. Application form for tourist hotel enterprise operating license.
2. Operating license of the tourist hotel enterprise previously issued.
3. Corporate charter, photocopy of documentary proof of corporate registration, and lists of board directors and supervisors of the continuing or newly established company.
The continuing or newly established company may apply, with reasonable cause, for the deadline stipulated in the preceding paragraph to be extended one time for two months.

In the event that the tourist hotel buildings operated by a tourist hotel enterprise are auctioned off by a court or taken over by a debtor in accordance with the law, the purchaser or receiver of the ownership, when applying for continued operation of the tourist hotel enterprise, shall produce the certificate of real estate ownership transfer and documentary proof of ownership, and follow the related procedures for establishing a tourist hotel enterprise by filing an application with the original processing authority for approval of such establishment and issuance of a license. When a third party obtains ownership of the tourist hotel enterprise from the purchaser or receiver as mentioned above, or is commissioned to operate the enterprise by the　purchaser or receiver, that third party shall follow the same procedures.
For an approved tourist hotel that occupies only part of a building that incorporates other building uses on the same foundation in an integrated design, an application for establishment need not include written agreement for the right of use of land not owned.
In an application as described in the preceding two paragraphs, in the event that the tourist hotel buildings are not subject to change of use, the review procedure shall apply the laws and regulations governing the application for the original establishment. In the event that the tourist hotel buildings are subject to change of use, the laws and regulations effective at the time of the application shall apply.

A tourist hotel enterprise that intends to suspend operations for more than one (1) month shall submit an application along with the minutes of stockholder meeting or written agreement of the stockholders to the original processing authority within fifteen (15) days following the suspension.
An application as indicated in the preceding paragraph may not be made for a suspension of operations in excess of one year. An enterprise may however apply, with reasonable justifications, for an extension of suspension for one year at most. The application for extension should be filed within the final fifteen (15) days of the original period of suspension. After the suspension period expires, the enterprise should file for business resumption with the administrative authority within fifteen (15) days.
In the event that a tourist hotel enterprise terminates its operation for some reason or its main tourist hotel building or buildings is/are destroyed, the enterprise shall within 15 days submit the following documents to apply to the original processing authority for the cancellation of its operating license:
1. The originally issued tourist hotel enterprise operating license, exclusive trade symbol for tourist hotels, and hotel rating symbol.
2. Minutes of stockholder meeting or written agreement of stockholders.
When the aforementioned application for cancellation is not made within the prescribed time, the original processing authority may cancel the tourist hotel enterprise’s operating license, exclusive trade symbol for tourist hotels, and hotel rating symbol.

A tourist hotel enterprise shall not have parts or all of its guest rooms leased out to be operated by other parties. When a tourist hotel enterprise has its restaurants, conference venues, or other affiliated facilities leased out to be operated by other parties, the leasee and employed personnel of the leasee shall comply with related provisions of this Regulation. In the event of any violation by the leasee or employed personnel of the leasee, the tourist hotel enterprise shall be held liable under relevant provisions of this Regulation.

A tourist hotel enterprise that intends to join an international or domestic hotel chain shall complete due procedures in accordance with relevant laws and regulations, after which the enterprise shall submit the contract and related documents to the original processing authority for file. When the original processing authority for file is a special municipality government under direct jurisdiction of the Executive Yuan, a copy of notice shall be sent to the Tourism Bureau of the MOTC.
A tourist hotel enterprise shall cooperate and participate actively in promotional campaigns organized by administrative authorities and other international non-governmental tourism associations.

A tourist hotel enterprise shall provide pre-vocational and on-the-job training to its employees. The administrative authority may provide assistance when necessary.
In order to enhance the qualification of the employees of tourist hotel enterprises, the administrative authority may organize professional training programs, to which tourist hotel enterprises shall send their employees to attend as required under related regulations. Attendees of these training programs shall conform to relevant regulations for trainees.
The administrative authority may charge registration fees, tuition fees and certificate fees for attendance in the professional training as indicated in the preceding paragraph.

法規內容.編章節: Chapter IV Management of Employees in Tourist Hotel Enterprise

法規內容.條文內容: Managers of a tourist hotel enterprise shall have professional knowledge and skills required by their specific business fields.

A tourist hotel enterprise shall establish different departments, each with an assigned manager, in accordance with the division of its business activities, and shall report the appointment of managers, as well as changes in the appointment, to the original administrative authority within fifteen (15) days upon the date of approval by the corporate administrative authority.

In order to enhance its overseas business, a tourist hotel enterprise may assign business representatives stationed in important places of foreign countries, and shall report to the original processing authority within one (1) month after such assignment.

A tourist hotel enterprise shall strengthen its personnel management by timely recording personnel changes, and shall be responsible for the supervision of the employees!| observance of relevant provisions in this Regulation.
The employees indicated in the preceding paragraph shall be provided with reasonable remunerations, which shall exclude tips.

A tourist hotel enterprise shall provide uniforms and easily identifiable badges for its employees.
The aforesaid employees shall wear uniform and the badge bearing personal name or code name, and shall not engage in any of the following behaviors:
1. Mediating sexual services for customers, hiring dance partners for customers, or engaging in other behavior against good social order.
2. Stealing or embezzling money and possessions of lodgers.
3. Defrauding lodgers.
4. Demanding extra charges from lodgers.
5. Conducting unauthorized exchange of foreign currencies.
The construction of a tourist hotel that conforms to the Standard for Buildings and Facilities of Tourist Hotels may be awarded by law.
In order to facilitate the construction of tourist hotels, the administrative authority when necessary may coordinate with land administration authorities to sell or lease out public lands by law.

The administrative authority may award or acknowledge a tourist hotel enterprise that meets one of the following conditions:
1. Makes a special contributions to maintain national honor or social order.
2. Performs in an outstanding manner in fostering international friendship through participation in international promotional campaigns.
3. Has an excellent record in improving management system and service quality.
4. Has performed in an outstanding manner in foreign exchange income.
5. Has other good conduct or practices deserving commendation.

The administrative authority may award or acknowledge the personnel of a tourist hotel enterprise that meets one of the following conditions:
1. Has an excellent record in promoting the tourism industry.
2. Has significant achievements in the research and development of tourist hotel management.
3. Has won favorable comments or has an impressive record as a result of delivering comprehensive tourist services.
4. Has performed in an outstanding manner in upholding national honor and fostering international friendship.
5. Has served with positive work attitude for the same business enterprise for over fifteen (15) years.
6. Has other good conduct or practices deserving commendation.

When a tourist hotel enterprise violates Article 6, Article 9, Article 11 to Article 13, Paragraph 4 of Article 14, Article 16 to Article 18, sub-paragraph 2 and sub-paragraph 3 in Article 20, Article 21 to Article 23, Paragraph 1 and Paragraph 2 of Article 24, Article 24-1, Article 25 to Article 27-1, Paragraph 3 of Article 29 to Article 31, Paragraph 2 of Article 33, Article 35, Article 37 or Paragraph 1 of Article 38 of this Regulation, punishment shall be imposed by the original processing authority in accordance with provisions in sub-paragraph 3 in Paragraph 2 of Article 55 of the Statute for the Development of Tourism.
When the employed personnel of a tourist hotel enterprise violate sub-paragraph 2, sub-paragraph 4 or sub-paragraph 5 in Paragraph 2 of Article 39, punishment shall be imposed by the original processing authority in accordance with provisions in sub-paragraph 2 of Paragraph 1 of Article 58 of the Statute for the Development of Tourism.

The fee standards of the stipulated fees to be collected by the administrative authority in accordance with these Regulations are as follows:
1. Issuance of tourist hotel enterprise operating license: NT$3,000.
2. Replacement or reissuance of tourist hotel enterprise operating license: NT$1,500.
3. Issuance or reissuance of exclusive trade symbol for international tourist hotel: NT$20,000; issuance or reissuance of exclusive trade symbol for ordinary tourist hotel: NT$15,000.
4. Tourist hotel review fee:
(1) For establishment of hotels with up to 100 rooms, NT$12,000 per case; for hotels with more than 100 rooms, an additional NT$6,000 for each additional 100 rooms.or portion thereof,with the fee for review of changers reduced by half.
(2) For change of a tourist hotel already in operation, NT$6,000 per case.
There will be no charge for registration certificate replacement necessitated by a change of address caused by the rezoning of the administrative district or by a change in the property numbering system affecting the hotel enterprise in question.
This Regulation shall become effective on the date of its promulgation.
